intro: Tetradenia boninensis, commonly known as the Bonin tetradenia, is a flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or lowland habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
